name: Holiday Inn Express Poughkeepsie

reviews.text: I was expecting opulence from this hotel because it's a Holiday Inn Express, but I was satisfied. I was here for two nights while in town for a conference, and it met my needs. It's very clean and the rooms look like they have been refurbished in the past few years. My room had a huge fridge and a microwave. The breakfast buffet is large with both hot and cold items, but if you want a healthy breakfast, your only option is fruit and yogurt (but maybe that's all you want).
reviews.title: Not opulent, but clean

reviews.text: The best part about this hotel is that it is located on Route 9 on a corner with a light, so it's easy to make a right or left-hand turn on to Route 9. It's also easy to make a left into the hotel from Route 9 south because there isn't a median like other parts of the road.
reviews.title: Clean simple stay for the price

reviews.text: Stayed a night and found the staff friendly and rooms clean. The breakfast was unexpectedly generous, with several hot items, not just bagels, cold cereal and toast. (Could use more healthier choices beyond just the fruit, though.) Wifi is free throughout the hotel room as it should be. Annoying you have to login every time, but that's fine.
reviews.title: Nice stay but no Marriott

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pool is nice. There's a washer and dryer facility that charges only for detergent. So if you're on the road a while, that'll be useful.
reviews.title: Great service - thank you!

reviews.text: Great overall for the money.
reviews.title: older property, great staff, poor wifi
i liked it ok
reviews.text: i liked it, i thought it was clean and comfortable. loved the tub.

reviews.title: disappointing
reviews.text: thought it was a little too exspensive tho.

reviews.title: Not likely to stay here again.
reviews.text: This hotel had a decent continental breakfast, but the room itself was not pleasant. The room and the entire hotel area had a strong hospital-like odor (urine, etc.) The outdoor pool was clean and enjoyable. The hotel desk personnel were very polite and friendly.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Simply put, they behave as though they are working in the Ritz-Carlton. Excellent service, very clean, well run. Compared to the other hotels we stopped in before finding them, they are tops by far!
reviews.title: 2 Thumbs Up for Cleanliness + Customer Service

reviews.text: Rii (I think?), then night receptionist was fantastic. When he processed our reservation at 3AM at the last minute, I knew we were at the right hotel.
reviews.title: We're at the hotel, motel, Holiday Inn....

reviews.text: I was in Poughkeepsie to visit family and chose the Holiday Inn Express because it was near their house. The hotel was clean and well run, just as I have come to expect from a Holiday Inn. Our room had a sofa, a mini refrigerator, a microwave, and a spotless bathroom. It wasn’t fancy, but the bed was comfortable and I enjoyed two nights of good sleep. The bonus to saying here is that they offer a nice continental breakfast with the price of the room. The pool looked inviting too, but I didn’t have an opportunity to use it.
reviews.title: Not great, but a decent place to stay

reviews.text: Front desk staff was friendly, but the AC in our room did not work well--was blowing out warm-ish air--and no one was able to help. We slept poorly because the room was so hot. When we called the front desk at night, they said they'd "have someone look at it in the morning," which didn't help on the 90+ degree night. In the morning we mentioned the issue at checkout, and the desk staff said "oh, yeah, there's a note about it here" but didn't offer anything else. Essentially I paid quite a bit of money for a night of poor sleep. Breakfast in the morning was standard, not great but not terrible either.
reviews.title: Great Location-Professional Staff

reviews.text: Overall stay was excellent. Oliver was very accommodating. The outdoor pool was wonderful. Bathroom was spotless. Large fridge and microwave and well lit parking lot. Was 20 minutes off of 87 but it was well worth it seeing other choices in the area.
reviews.title: Great experience!

reviews.text: This Holiday Inn Express is just what you need when you want a clean, convenient, well-maintained hotel. I would not even review it - it's really just what you would expect a Holiday Inn to be - except for the great service of all staff, especially Oliver. I had a problem with a reservation by hotels.com and they would not help me out at all. Oliver was great. Kept in touch via cell phone and found us a room with a king sized bed & pullout sofa. The rest of the stay was fine, breakfast was not fancy - no omelet stations here - but certainly had plenty of choices for everyone. Location was ideal for all our sightseeing. But the best thing about this hotel was the willingness of staff to do whatever they could for their guests.
reviews.title: Excellent Service

reviews.text: The people who work at this hotel are the nicest people I have ever met.
reviews.title: greatest time at hotel ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They were wonderful to me and my son.
reviews.title: Very nice stay

reviews.text: We loved our stay. I had a great vacation thanks to them. I wish I was still there. I was so sorry to leave. My room was clean. I could talk to the people at the front desk and they would always help me. I felt very safe there. I loved loved loved my vacation and my stay there.
reviews.title: Good place to stay

reviews.text: God Bless all of them.Thank You, Mary and her son John.
reviews.title: Clean, comfortable, efficient

reviews.text: The room was clean, beds and service fine, but the cost was out of line for the area. Especially because 2 weeks later I stayed at a much nicer hotel, a few miles south of there and paid half as much. This hotel is very near Marist and Vassar colleges and I guess that's why they feel they can charge so much.
reviews.title: very pricey

reviews.text: My suggestion, look a little further south and get a much better deal!
reviews.title: good value
Renovating...why?
reviews.text: If we ever return to the Hudson River Valley, we will definitely stay here again. Good location, excellent shopping and restaurants nearby, as well as attractions. More importantly, the service at this hotel was excellent, the staff friendly, the breakfast was very good, the rooms clean and well-maintained.

reviews.title: Very Nice but Expensive
reviews.text: I recently stayed at this hotel due to its convenient location. I pulled into the parking lot and initially thought the outside of the building was old looking and thought the inside would be the same. I could not be more wrong! The lobby was warm, inviting and very clean. The woman who checked me in was very professional and friendly. She informed me that the hotel was actually getting a new exterior this Fall..Hmmm and a new lobby, I said why this lobby is great. My room was very nice, looked brand new, great pillows, even better bathroom, the shower was great the towels thick and new looking. My so called continental breakfast turned out to have a cheese omlet and bacon! I even got to enjoy it outside on the patio. Over all this was the best Holiday Inn Express I had ever stayed in. I would definitely recommend it to anyone who has to go to Poughkeepsie.

A sign in the lobby announced this property will be undergoing a full renovation in the fall of 2005, but I think it is already the nicest Holiday Inn Express I have ever seen. We had a king room with a sofa bed, on the non-highway side of the hotel that was quite pleasant. Everything appeared clean and in good repair, except one lamp that should be replaced. There was some hallway noise, but I have learned to turn up the A/C fan to drown out the noisy guests. There were three different pillow types on the bed to ensure you get the type you like. A hairdryer and iron were standard. There was a microwave for guest use in the vending area. The bathroom had a spacious layout, and an attractive sink area with a separate upper shelf for the coffeemaker (which just makes sense!) The shower curtain was a bright white woven cloth variety that contributed to the spotless appearance of the bathroom. The towels were thick, and the toiletries somewhat unique. The lobby area was attractive and offered some board games for wholesome fun as well as a high speed Internet-connected PC for guest use. The continental plus breakfast offerings were extensive, but there was a wait for the four-slice toaster. I thought the desk staff could use a few pointers in customer service. They weren’t rude, but weren’t overly welcoming either. I used my Priority Club points to stay here at no charge, but I thought the rack rate was outrageous for a non-full service or extended stay hotel. I would put this property in the “nice place to stay if somebody else is paying” category.
reviews.title: Not likely to stay here again
Decent but overpiced
reviews.text: Stayed for 1 night. Staff was friendly and room was clean and had all we needed but the price of the room was over the top. Heat was difficult to regulate (only at the unit). For the price of the room one should be able to set the temperature in the room to a set temperature. We woke up in the middle of the night when it was way too warm and we had to turn down the heat.
The room key also did not work properly. Had to really fiddle for the door to open. Seemed that it was due to an old locking mechanism.
reviews.title: Clean nice place!

reviews.text: The beds were hard, but to our liking (some other folks we talked to thought they were too hard). The coffee was very good. Breakfast was so so. Everything was buffet style and we had to use throw away plates. Next time we'll bring our own cereamic plates (fortunately we had brought our own decent tea/coffee cups). The breakfast room was actually too small for the hotel. Came down at 9.15am when the room was packed. Returned at 9.45 when we found a table. Had we been in a rush we would have missed out on the breakfast that is included in the price.
reviews.title: Pleasant stay in Poughkeepsie

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Traveled in this area and stayed here for a night with 3 friends. Very nice layout of room, clean room. The bathroom was decet sized unlike some tight hotel bathrooms. They had a decent sized breakfast bar in the AM as well.
reviews.title: Decent Hotel

reviews.text: Aside from the absolutely absurd cost of $300 a night (tax included) because it was Family Weekend at Marist, this is a very nice property. Everything was very clean, new and up to date. The wifi was slow, but that's pretty standard at hotels. The breakfast was decent, with a limited selection but perfectly acceptable. The staff was friendly and eager to please.
reviews.title: Fine hotel in Poughkeepsie!

reviews.text: A friend and I spent a night here recently on a weekend visit to the area to shop and tour and eat at the Culinary Institute of America, which is a 10-minute drive away in Hyde Park. The hotel is very clean, the bed comfortable, the complimentary hot and cold breakfast satisfying, and the staff friendly and helpful. I'd definitely stay here again if I need a place to stay while visiting for a weekend.
reviews.title: Very nice place to stay

reviews.text: Had to visit NY for family issues - this HI was convenient for everything we had to take care of.
reviews.title: Multiple Stays

reviews.text: The staff is friendly, helpful and accommodating to our needs. The room was especially clean, quiet, the beds comfy and the cinnamon rolls are a breakfast must. Know we will have to travel back to NY and this will be our only choice for a place to stay.
reviews.title: I will be back!

reviews.text: We needed a place to stay the night before skiing at Mohonk. Found this hotel online and read the reviews, which were correct. It was clean, comfortable, updated, quiet. No problems whatsoever. Staff was very nice. Breakfast was very good too. We would stay here again, absolutely.
reviews.title: Very good place to stay

reviews.text: Holiday Inn Express Poughkeepsie was our motel of choice based on previous reviews. We were pleased. The place was very clean, including the bathroom, beds confortable, quiet, the check-in staff was excellent, breakfast was appropriate, overall value was good, the location was ideal. No complaints.
reviews.title: pretty good
Beware of the house keepers
reviews.text: I came here with my 16 year old daughter and two young grandsons (6 and 7 years old). Our stay was very pleasant. Staff the night we arrived were very nice. Althought the next morning we went down to the free breakfest, we were there for about 20 minutes. When we went back upstairs to finish getting our belongings and wait to check out to leave and meet our other family members, we found house keeping already in our room. We went up to the door and the lady had the door blocked and would not move her cart. When I approched the door she had told me we were only there for one night, and I'm like yes but I have not checked out yet check out isnt untill 12:00 noon. She walked out the door and we pushed through the cart to get inside the room to get the rest of our belongings. While gathering our stuff the lady walked in with fresh bedding and proceded to put them on the bed. We went downstairs and demanded to talk to a manager but there was not one available they told us. We were told that I would be contacted that night, which I was not. They had contacted head of house keeping. The head of house keeping said they would go and talk to the lady who was already in our room. We obviously could not go back to our room untill we were ready to check out so I had to go sit in a grocery store parking lot untill our family members arrived. After calling back that night when we got back home I talked to a lady at the desk who said that there wouldnt be a manager on untill the next morning. She wrote down everything I told her and stated that I would get a call from a manager the next day. The next day the manager called me. He appoligized for what had happened, and said he would call me back on Tuesday (2 days from when I talked to him) to tell me what was going on and to try to make things right. He was very nice and had explained to me that house keeping should not have been in my room.
The last time I rated this hotel I gave it a 5. A few things have changed since then: I've become more experienced with business travel and this time there were a few heavy score impacting problems.
reviews.title: My Second Visit

likes.disliked: — Stained bedding and noisy adjoining room

reviews.text: We stayed in this hotel last year and had a wonderful experience. Everything was what we had expected. However, upon returning this month for another college visit with my daughter and her friend we were very disappointed. We had booked two rooms from the online site (one with double beds and the other a king size bed). When we arrived both rooms had double beds in them. We were told by the front desk that they had no more king size rooms available for the night even though I had a confirmation for one. Check in starts at 3:00 and we were there at 4:00. Needless to say, we will be looking for another place to call home away from home when our daughter goes to college nearby.
reviews.title: disappointed the second time
Great Place to stay!
reviews.text: My room was exactly what I was looking for.....King size bed, lots of pillows, quiet and clean room, friendly staff.....I was left alone, but yet there was help if I needed it. Great price....I was very happy with my stay. Very convenient location. I stayed for 3 days/nights.

I hadn't been to the Poughkeepsie area for a couple of years but my work brought me back to the area so I went with what I knew. When I stayed at the Holiday Inn Express in 2005 nothing really stuck out to me but it wasn't bad either so I figured it was okay to stay there again. I was greatly surprised to see the huge improvements inside and outside! It looks absolutely great! The room was quiet, clean and comfortable. They've got highspeed wireless internet now which is awesome because i've got to download large files for work and I didn't have any problems with it. ANd the breakfast I was very happy with. I was very surprised to see scrambled eggs and bacon - I thought they might be powdered - nope - they seemed to be fresh and they were even hot!! The staff was great too. Their attitude this time around is what sticks out to me, they were very pleasant and friendly. Even the housekeepers were nice. I needed directions to a couple of different locations for work and the desk staff gave me directions they had already printed up. Talk about knowing what you need ahead of time. This is a great place to stay! So much better than I remembered. My company is expanding into the Poughkeepsie area and I will definitely stay here again and as more and more people come in from my company I will have them stay here as well. In my opinion Holiday Inn Express is the place to stay!
reviews.title: Excellent improvements

reviews.text: I have stayed here 3 times while attending swim meets at Marist. This hotel has great location. You can enjoy everything the Hudson Valley has to offer. As for the hotel, the staff and management was up to par with everything. Every request was taken care of. The breakfast staff was extemely friendly. Front desk recommended places to visit in the area. Request a top floor for peace and comfort. Rooms very clean. Would have given 5 stars but all the times I have visited there has been a wedding party. No problems so far but have dodged many bullets. Love peace and quiet. But I understand why groups gather here, just a great Holiday Inn.
reviews.title: Cozy stay and very pleased

reviews.text: Stayed here on a Hotwire reservation and everything was great. It's a typical Holiday Inn- nicer then many I have stayed in. Staff was great. Very clean. Typical Holiday Inn breakfast (good or bad depending on your taste). Good location between old downtown and the newer restaurants/ stores south of town. I got a great price on Hotwire which made it really worth it... the initial prices I saw online from other sites were closer to the "higher end" chains and if prices are close on my next trip I would still probably stay with them (Hilton, Marriott). But if you get a good price this place is clean, nice and a good value.
reviews.title: Clean & Modern- Nice Place -Would Stay Again

reviews.text: I have no idea what people are complaining about. I received a great rate on Hotwire and am totally pleased. The hotel was clean, room was very comfortable, employees were extremely friendly and helpful, breakfast was plentiful and full of options. The hotel is located on route 9 and is easy to navigate to "downtown" Poughkeepsie and is not far from 84. Despite being close to a busy road, I never once heard a peep from passing cars.
reviews.title: Perfect for what it is...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only things that were even moderately an issue is that the shower does take a little bit of time to warm up. The free wi-fi was also a bit slow and was difficult to connect to (although this was probably my comp's problem.) I would recommend staying on a higher floor to avoid elevator/laundry noise that was more apparent on the 1st floor. Either way, I would definitely stay here again!
reviews.title: Worked for us

reviews.text: Although there are mixed reviews here I am glad we stayed. It is right on the highway, which is extremely busy but we didn't have a problem sleeping & the access was easy for the many local attractions.
reviews.title: perfectly adequate

reviews.text: Reception was extremely friendly and room was clean. However, there was always a faint smell of smoke, even though I was in a non-smoking room. Bed as very comfortable with a wide variety of pillows. Hotel is convenient to restaurants and shopping on Route 9 in Poughkeepsie.
reviews.title: Clean, friendly property

reviews.text: What a nice place. We loved the people, the cleaningness, the service and how well kept it is. The included breakfast was also well presented and had very good choices. I would stay here again without a doubt.
reviews.title: Well kept, great service and clean

reviews.text: Our family often stays at higher end hotels on vacation, but my daughter and I were just traveling around looking at colleges, staying at each place just one night. We just wanted to sleep well and not pay too much. I was very pleasantly surprised at the quality of this hotel. The beds were comfy, everything was clean, it was quiet, the complimentary breakfast was simple but nicely done, and the fitness room was very adequate. As a result of this stay, I will look into other Holiday Inn Express hotels in the future.
reviews.title: Great night's sleep at a great value!

reviews.text: I was so very pleasantly surprised with this stay. You see my Dad had just died and we were in Poughkeepsie to bury him. This entire ordeal was extremely rushed and stressful as my stepmother wanted to get him in the ground before Thanksgiving. He died on the 18th and I had to get my kids home from various colleges and airports then be in Poughkeepsie to wake/bury him on the evening of the 20th/21st.
reviews.title: Comfortable stay just when I needed it!

reviews.text: At check-in Rachel had a gift for us as Priority members. I cannot tell you how very welcome the bottle of water and snacks were! The room was just perfect. Clean, crisp and conducive to a quick nap before the wake.
reviews.title: Solid, predictable experience - no surprises

reviews.text: It was a little eerie being in a hotel 1/4 full, but the room was great.
reviews.title: Convenient, clean hotel, good breakfast

reviews.text: The pool was a bit dirty, (lots of bugs and debris), but we swam anyway.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: Best continental breakfast I have had at a hotel. Yogurts and healthy options and fruit cups, bagels and muffins and cereal, eggs and oatmeal. Staff on top of it to keep it fresh.
reviews.title: A great stay at a great price

reviews.text: We stayed here in early July for a family wedding that took place at the Vassar College Chapel. This hotel was very conveniently located for the both the wedding & the reception. In addition, many sites such as the FDR home & Presidential library and the Vanderbilt House are just a short drive down the road.
reviews.title: Top Notch Hotel

reviews.text: I have to commend the front desk staff for all of their help & support when our car battery died right after we checked in. In addition, they had menus on hand so we could order lunch while waiting for the auto club to come change the battery.
reviews.title: Nicely located, clean, efficient

reviews.text: I recently stayed overnight on business at the Poughkeepsie Holiday Inn Express. The front desk staff were very friendly and accomodating, and check-in was easy. My room was very clean, but unfortunately smelled of smoke, as if it had once been a smoking room, but was now non-smoking.
reviews.title: Clean hotel with friendly, helpful staff.
A OK For a night
reviews.text: The hotel's walls and doors are thin - I could hear doors closing and people knocking far into the night, and I'm usually not bothered by this at hotels. The bed was very comfortable, however, and the sheets and towels smelled very fresh.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There was a wide selection of food for breakfast, although the quality was not up to the standards of other chains. The food was kept well-stocked.
reviews.title: Satisfactory

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is located in a convenient area, near lots of convenience stores and restaurants. Although my stay was satisfactory, I would probably stay somewhere else next time.
reviews.title: Two nights on the road

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed one night at the start of our vacation. Drove up from the Woodbury Common Outlets. It was an eay drive but crossing at Poughkeepsie instead of further South would have been even easier. The hotel is just south of the bridge. Hotel was a nice, clean HI Express and convenient to both CIA and FDR library. Both were great.. Also easy to get to northwest MA from here.
reviews.title: Not bad... but could be better.

description: Welcome to the Holiday Inn Express Hotel in Poughkeepsie, New York.At the moment you enter the bright, airy lobby of the Holiday Inn Express hotel Poughkeepsie, you are welcomed into a unique hotel with a mix of contemporary chic and charming traditional ambiance, personalized service, and contemporary amenities.The Holiday Inn Express Poughkeepsie government hotel is centrally located in the Hudson Valley area of New York near many attractions such as FDR Presidential Library, Vanderbilt Mansion and Eleanor Roosevelt Cottage, and only 20 Miles south of Historic Rhinebeck, New York. Our hotel is near IBM, The Culinary Institute of America, Marist College and Vassar College. We are also minutes away from Vassar Brothers Hospital and St. Francis Hospital. Our newly renovated Poughkeepsie hotel features well appointed guest rooms, Free Wireless High Speed Internet Access, a Seasonal Outdoor Pool, Complimentary Local Shuttle Service limited, Free Guest Laundry Services, and 24 Hour Business Center with printing service. Start the day right with our Complimentary Express Start Breakfast Bar served every morning featuring the world's best tasting hot cinnamon roll, and many other delicious breakfast items including eggs, bacon, and sausage.Visit Poughkeepsie, NY and Stay Smart at the Holiday Inn Express Poughkeepsie Hotel.
